original: Arvidsson, Per Teofil Yngve, kyrkoherde, Hovmantorp, f. 19/4/99 i Vitta-ryd, Kronob. 1., av kyrkoh. Severin A. o. Anna Johnson. G. 28 m. gymn:dir. Margit Andersson. Barn: Karin f. 30, Erik 32, Johan 34. — Studrex. i Jönköp. 17, fil. kand. i Upps. 20, teol. kand., prakt. teol. prov samt prästv. f. Växjö stift 24. Tjg. s. v. pastor i Stenbrohult 25, kommin. i Aringsås 26, kyrkoh. i Bankeryd 31, i Hovmantorp sed. 40. Smål. nat. i Upps. förste kurator 23-24, bitr. resesekr. f. Växjö stiftsråd 26-31, led. av styr. f. stiftets prästänkehem sed. 34, omb. f. Sv. kyrkans sjöm:v:styr. sed. 35, led. av stiftsrådet sed. s. å., suppl. f. prästerl. led. av domkap. 37-47, ord. led. av domkap. >sed. 47. Orator v. prästmötet 41. Skr. : upps., predikn. m. m. i pubil., tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Arvidsson, Per Teofil Yngve, pastor, Hovmantorp, born on April 19th, 1899 in Vitta-ryd, Kronoburg County, first child of pastor Severin A. and Anna Johnson. Married to Margit Andersson, a gymnastics teacher, on June 28th, with three children: Karin born in 1930, Erik in 1932, and Johan in 1934. He studied at Jönköping University in 1917, graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala University in 1920, earned a degree in theology, practiced practical theology, and was ordained a priest for the Diocese of Växjö in 1924. He served as deputy pastor in Stenbrohult from 1925-1926, as curate in Aringsås from 1926-1931, and as pastor in Bankeryd from 1931-1940, before finally serving as pastor in Hovmantorp. He was the first curator for the Småland provincial council in Uppsala University from 1923-1924, deputy travel secretary for the Diocese of Växjö from 1926-1931, a member of the board for the diocese's widows' home since 1934, a delegate for the Swedish Church's seamen's council since 1935, a member of the diocesan council since the same year, and a substitute member for the priests' council for the cathedral chapter from 1937-1947, becoming a full member in 1947. He served as an orator for the priests' meeting in 1941 and wrote research papers, sermons, and more for publication in periodicals and newspapers.
